diagnoses.name: Systemic Lupus Erythematosus (SLE)
diagnoses.rationale: SLE can present with a wide range of symptoms, including autoimmune hemolysis, neurological manifestations (e.g., seizures), oral ulcers, arthropathy, and skin manifestations such as atrophic scarring.

diagnoses.name: Antiphospholipid Syndrome
diagnoses.rationale: While primarily known for causing vascular thrombosis and miscarriages, antiphospholipid syndrome can be associated with seizures, livedo reticularis which might lead to atrophic scarring, and other systemic features.

diagnoses.name: Rheumatoid Arthritis (RA) with Felty's Syndrome
diagnoses.rationale: RA is primarily an arthritic condition, but Felty's syndrome, an uncommon complication, can lead to autoimmune hemolysis. RA can also feature oral ulcers in severe cases.

diagnoses.name: Behçet's Disease
diagnoses.rationale: Behçet's disease is characterized by oral ulcers, genital ulcers, and uveitis but can also cause neurological symptoms (including seizures), arthropathy, and skin manifestations.

diagnoses.name: Systemic Sclerosis (Scleroderma)
diagnoses.rationale: Systemic sclerosis can lead to atrophic scarring due to skin involvement. It may also feature some systemic complications such as rare hemolytic anemia, arthritic symptoms, and neurological involvement.

diagnoses.name: Mixed Connective Tissue Disease (MCTD)
diagnoses.rationale: MCTD is a condition that features signs and symptoms of multiple autoimmune diseases, including SLE, scleroderma, and polymyositis. It could explain the combination of symptoms presented.

diagnoses.name: Sjögren's Syndrome
diagnoses.rationale: While primarily associated with sicca symptoms, Sjögren's can present with neurological complications (such as seizures), arthropathy, and has been associated with autoimmune hemolysis.

diagnoses.name: Evans Syndrome
diagnoses.rationale: Evans syndrome is a rare autoimmune disorder that combines autoimmune hemolytic anemia (AIHA) with immune thrombocytopenia (ITP) and sometimes autoimmune neutropenia. While not directly causing the full spectrum of symptoms listed, its basis in autoimmunity could suggest overlapping syndromes.

diagnoses.name: Dermatomyositis
diagnoses.rationale: Dermatomyositis is chiefly characterized by muscle weakness and a distinctive skin rash, but it can have systemic effects. There could be overlap with connective tissue diseases that explain the range of symptoms.

diagnoses.name: Autoimmune Lymphoproliferative Syndrome
diagnoses.rationale: This rare condition involves abnormal growth of immune cells and can lead to autoimmune cytopenias, including hemolytic anemia. Additional symptoms might overlap with other autoimmune disorders, implying a broad differential diagnosis.

diagnoses: Drug reaction with eosinophilia and systemic symptoms (DRESS syndrome)
Hepatitis B and C related glomerulonephritis
Schizophrenia (in the context of an autoimmune disorder with CNS involvement)
Vitamin Deficiencies (e.g., Vitamin B12, Vitamin D)

diagnoses.name: Diabetes Mellitus
diagnoses.reasoning: Glycemic lability is a hallmark symptom.

diagnoses.name: Human Immunodeficiency Virus (HIV) Infection
diagnoses.reasoning: Lymphadenopathy and periodontal disease are common; cognitive impairment may cause word-finding difficulty.

diagnoses.name: Sjögren's Syndrome
diagnoses.reasoning: Periodontal disease due to dry mouth, lymphadenopathy from chronic inflammation.

diagnoses.name: Vitamin B12 Deficiency
diagnoses.reasoning: Can cause cognitive issues (word-finding difficulty) and periodontal disease due to mucosal changes.

diagnoses.name: Systemic Lupus Erythematosus (SLE)
diagnoses.reasoning: Lymphadenopathy and cognitive dysfunction; less directly related to periodontal disease and glycemic lability.

diagnoses.name: Rheumatoid Arthritis
diagnoses.reasoning: Secondary Sjögren's can contribute to periodontal disease; lymphadenopathy from chronic inflammation.

diagnoses.name: Syphilis
diagnoses.reasoning: Can cause periodontal disease and lymphadenopathy; neurosyphilis could lead to cognitive symptoms.

diagnoses.name: Gingivostomatitis
diagnoses.reasoning: Directly linked to periodontal disease; systemic involvement could explain lymphadenopathy.

diagnoses.name: Lymphoma
diagnoses.reasoning: Primary symptom is lymphadenopathy; can cause systemic issues affecting cognition and periodontal health.

diagnoses.name: Diabetic Neuropathy
diagnoses.reasoning: Secondary to diabetes; links glycemic lability with potential for cognitive issues regarding word-finding difficulty.

diagnoses.name: Allergic Rhinitis
diagnoses.description: An allergy-related condition that leads to swollen, inflamed nasal passages and symptoms such as sneezing, itchiness, and a blocked or runny nose. It can also cause eye irritation and focus issues due to associated inflammation.

diagnoses.name: Asthma
diagnoses.description: A condition in which your airways narrow and swell and may produce extra mucus. This can lead to breathing difficulties, wheezing, and coughing.

diagnoses.name: Drug Reaction or Side Effect
diagnoses.description: Adverse reactions to medication can include hypersensitivity reactions, constipation, vision problems, or respiratory symptoms such as wheezing.

diagnoses.name: Anaphylaxis
diagnoses.description: A severe, potentially life-threatening allergic reaction that can occur rapidly, leading to symptoms like difficulty breathing, wheezing, and hypotension. It requires immediate medical attention.

diagnoses.name: Sinusitis
diagnoses.description: Inflammation of the sinuses that can lead to congestion, facial pain, nasal discharge, and sometimes difficulty focusing due to headache or pressure.

diagnoses.name: Foreign Body in Respiratory Tract
diagnoses.description: The presence of an object in the respiratory tract can cause wheezing, difficulty breathing, and potentially hypersensitivity reactions if the body perceives it as a threat.

diagnoses.name: Irritable Bowel Syndrome (IBS)
diagnoses.description: A chronic condition that affects the large intestine, leading to symptoms such as cramping, abdominal pain, bloating, gas, and constipation or diarrhea.

diagnoses.name: Hereditary Hemorrhagic Telangiectasia (HHT)
diagnoses.description: A genetic disorder that affects blood vessel formation and can lead to recurrent nosebleeds (epistaxis), among other symptoms.

diagnoses.name: Hypothyroidism
diagnoses.description: A condition in which the thyroid gland doesn't produce enough thyroid hormones. Symptoms can include constipation, dry skin, weight gain, and potential effects on respiratory function.

diagnoses.name: Inflammatory Bowel Disease (IBD)
diagnoses.description: A term for two conditions (Crohn's disease and ulcerative colitis) that are characterized by chronic inflammation of the gastrointestinal tract, leading to symptoms including constipation, abdominal pain, diarrhea, and extraintestinal manifestations such as hypersensitivity reactions.

diagnoses: Squamous cell carcinoma of the vulva
Asthma (in the context of an allergic reaction)
Viral infections (e.g., Parvovirus B19, Epstein-Barr virus)
Still's disease (Adult-onset Still's disease or Systemic-onset juvenile idiopathic arthritis)
Schizophrenia (for isolated psychosis, considering the broad reach of symptoms)
Peripheral Neuropathy, Myopathy, Hoarseness, and Hearing Loss
Viral infections (e.g., HIV, Epstein-Barr virus, Hepatitis)
Evans Syndrome (autoimmune hemolytic anemia with immune thrombocytopenia)
Viral Infections (e.g., Dengue Fever, Zika Virus)
Chronic Hepatitis B or C infection
Rheumatoid Arthritis with secondary Sjögren's syndrome
Viral infections (such as HIV or Hepatitis C)
